title: Najir Husen
text:
Mohamad Najir Husen known as Najir Husen is a <a href="Nepalis">Nepalese</a> film actor, known for his work in the Nepalese entertainment industry. One of the most critically acclaimed actors in Nepal, Najir began his career in acting at the Mandala Theater, <a href="Nepal">Nepal</a>. He received fame for his role in <a href="Hostel%20Returns">Hostel Returns</a> as Rameshwor Yadav and Bikram in <a href="Bir%20Bikram%202">Bir Bikram 2</a>. Husen has also starred in many music videos as well.
Career.
He was born in <a href="Dumbarwana">Dumbarwana</a>, <a href="Bara%20District">Bara District</a>, Nepal.
Theater and the beginning.
Najir initially came to Kathmandu to pursue his studies and improve his dancing skills. He joined a contemporary ballet class in Kathmandu. His teacher found him expressive and suggested he join an acting class. Najir then joined as a trainee in Mandala Theater Nepal in Kathmandu. His first theatre drama was "Charandas Chor", where he had a small role; he received a lead role in the drama "Buddha Baani".
Najir got his film break as "Helmet Guy" in <a href="Priyanka%20Karki">Priyanka Karki</a> and Samyam Puri starred Punte Parade. The film was not commercially successful and thus Najir did not get much recognition.
Hostel returns and success.
Najir played the role of Rameshwor Yadav in <a href="Hostel%20Returns">Hostel Returns</a>. His role and acting was publicly acclaimed, and he became popular overnight. He then acted in successful movies like "Junge", "<a href="Bir%20Bikram">Bir Bikram</a> and its sequel" Bir Bikram 2 and critically acclaimed drama "<a href="Gaatho">Gaatho</a>".
